channel.title: neXus with iBot pro 18 released FREE ALL OS Functional! Runescape BOT
channel.description:
[img]http://www.rscheata.net/tp/Smileys/Smile/occasion13.gif[/img] iBot pro on neXus
Approx. a year ago iBot pro on neXus was launched offering the Contributor verision to non-coders, iBot on nexus was already in use for nearly 6 months before this. Deisgned with 2 things in mind Speed and Undetectability. It was the best, but it was lacking minimizeability to the public. For a year now we have used this bot... In reverence of its 1 year anniversary here is a FREEBIE! Enjoy!
[img]http://www.rscheata.net/images/ibotlitesmall.png[/img]
UML Diagrams: nexus18\documentation\uml http://staticimp.com/rulercorner/1800/uml
Javadocs: nexus18\documentation\javadocs http://staticimp.com/rulercorner/1800/docs
Fixes:
[ul][li]Logout tab fixed[/li][li]Other tabs moved[/li][li]Compliant with newest Java version[/li][li]SWT updated[/li][li]CPU usage should be more like the early 17.x[/li][li]Complier being slow[/li][/ul]
Additions
[ul][li]reflection info pulled from webserver for seemless updates[/li][li]different nexus versions allowed and switching wihtout having to copy scripts.[/li][/ul] But script re-compiling might be needed after a switch.
[ul][li]different nexus versions to let people test new builds and if issues they can go back.[/li][/ul]
New installer: [img]http://staticimp.com/rulercorner/install.png[/img] [img]http://staticimp.com/rulercorner/install2.png[/img]
[b]We might now support platforms we did not before![/b]
Download: http://staticimp.com/rulercorner/1800/nexus18.rar
Support: http://www.rscheata.net/
Scripts: http://www.rscheata.net/tp/index.php?page=50
[img]http://i156.photobucket.com/albums/t30/mosesdog2/MyAntiDrug-1.jpg[/img]

item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

After reading the whole post, the only thought that I could not get out of my head was how much I hate magenta keywords.

Thank you,

This post did solve an argument I had with someone here at work. I had made the comment that even absolute nothings can use swt. He didn’t believe me until I showed him this thread.

Now that I got my token anti-ruler sentiment taken care of, congrats on what I assume is a stable app.

Read full topic

item.title: neXus with iBot pro 18 released FREE ALL OS Functional! Runescape BOT
item.dc:creator: @ruler ruler
item.description:
@ruler wrote:

The use of SWT was my decision. I recall that just about everyone was against my choice.

Our early input solutions made using swing difficult.

SWT provided us alot of win32 API use in Java our orignal intended minimzing solution was to be at the operating system level specifically windows.

SWT has support for a good amount of platforms
Windows (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-win32-win32-x86.zip 4.8 MB swt-3.4M4-win32-win32-x86.zip (md5) (sha1)
Windows (x86_64) (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-win32-win32-x86_64.zip 5 MB swt-3.4M4-win32-win32-x86_64.zip (md5) (sha1)
Windows (x86/WPF) early access (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-wpf-win32-x86.zip 2.9 MB swt-3.4M4-wpf-win32-x86.zip (md5) (sha1)
Windows CE (ARM PocketPC) (Instructions) swt-3.4M4-win32-wce_ppc-arm-j2se.zip 1.7 MB swt-3.4M4-win32-wce_ppc-arm-j2se.zip (md5) (sha1)
Windows CE (ARM PocketPC, J2ME profile) (Instructions) swt-3.4M4-win32-wce_ppc-arm-j2me.zip 1.7 MB swt-3.4M4-win32-wce_ppc-arm-j2me.zip (md5) (sha1)
Linux (x86/GTK 2) (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-gtk-linux-x86.zip 4.2 MB swt-3.4M4-gtk-linux-x86.zip (md5) (sha1)
Linux (x86_64/GTK 2) (Instructions) swt-3.4M4-gtk-linux-x86_64.zip 4.4 MB swt-3.4M4-gtk-linux-x86_64.zip (md5) (sha1)
Linux (PPC/GTK 2) (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-gtk-linux-ppc.zip 4.3 MB swt-3.4M4-gtk-linux-ppc.zip (md5) (sha1)
Linux (x86/Motif) (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-motif-linux-x86.zip 5.6 MB swt-3.4M4-motif-linux-x86.zip (md5) (sha1)
Solaris 8 (SPARC/GTK 2) swt-3.4M4-gtk-solaris-sparc.zip 4.2 MB swt-3.4M4-gtk-solaris-sparc.zip (md5) (sha1)
Solaris 8 (SPARC/Motif) swt-3.4M4-motif-solaris-sparc.zip 3.9 MB swt-3.4M4-motif-solaris-sparc.zip (md5) (sha1)
HPUX (ia64_32/Motif) swt-3.4M4-motif-hpux-ia64_32.zip 4 MB swt-3.4M4-motif-hpux-ia64_32.zip (md5) (sha1)
QNX (x86/Photon) swt-3.4M4-photon-qnx-x86.zip 2.8 MB swt-3.4M4-photon-qnx-x86.zip (md5) (sha1)
AIX (PPC/Motif) swt-3.4M4-motif-aix-ppc.zip 4 MB swt-3.4M4-motif-aix-ppc.zip (md5) (sha1)
Mac OSX (Mac/Carbon) (Supported Versions) swt-3.4M4-carbon-macosx.zip 4.1 MB swt-3.4M4-carbon-macosx.zip (md5) (sha1)

We have had different behavior observations from operating system to operating system. Swing also has some of these issues.

BAsh’s does have points.
It does greatly increase the download size.

We currently have 1 platform dependency issue. Apple has released only a beta Java 6 64 bit JVM, no 32 bit one.
SWT for mac is only 32 bit right now. Apple is behind on Java compatibility.

My current options i belive are:
Tell mac users to try this:
http://landonf.bikemonkey.org/static/soylatte/
or
Compile nexus in a Java 5 version that Apple has and instruct mac users to instead install a old Apple Java 5 JVM.

Frankly, it makes me hate Apple.

The un-intended benifits from using SWT have been:
All gui data structures can only be modified from one thread. May not seem like a benifit but it is, i can assume many of data structures i have will be only modified from one thread. Operations in the bot are guarnteed to be serial not parallel. I moved most of the nexus level api into the gui thread which other threads pile jobs on to.

Original reason for chooing SWT

[ul][li]lower cpu/ram usuage[/li][li]easier for the users to understand the gui, familar look and feel[/li][li]More out-of-box widgets to use, less buggy advance widgets[/li][li]smaller widget size so i can fit more widgets on the screen.[/li][/ul]

Read full topic
item.source: neXus with iBot pro 18 released FREE ALL OS Functional! Runescape BOT

item.title: neXus with iBot pro 18 released FREE ALL OS Functional! Runescape BOT
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Why do you use platform limiting GUIs anyway? Why cant you use swing like everyone else? It won’t take long to swap the code over and they use the same basic API and structure. The benefits would be decreased startup times as well as a smaller download. It also means that you don’t have to deal with the platform dependent problems as outlined by yourself above.

I’m going away for a week so somebody will have to take over flaming them for using a 3rd party API.

Read full topic
